greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Base-8 Armstrong or narcissistic numbers (written in base 10).
comment: Like the other single-digit terms, zero would satisfy the definition (n = Sum_{i=1..k} d[i]^k when d[1..k] are the base 8 digits of n), but here only positive numbers are considered. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 20 2019
link: Joseph Myers, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..62 (the full list of terms, from Winter)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Narcissistic Number
D. T. Winter, Table of Armstrong Numbers
example: 432 = 660_8, and 6^3 + 6^3 + 0^3 = 432; it's easy to see that 432 + 1 then also satisfies the equation, as for any term that is a multiple of 8. (End)
program: (PARI) select( {is_A010354(n)=n==vecsum([d^#n|d<-n=digits(n,8)])}, [0..10^6]) \\ This gives only terms < 10^6, for illustration of is_A010354(). - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 20 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
